title: Is it considered safe or harmful to swim in a pool with algae? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pool water usually turns green due to one of three reasons. There’s algae and not enough chlorine; there’s too much copper; or, pollen falling from nearby trees has discolored the water. You will know if pollen is the cause because if you swirl your hand through the water, the pollen with move. If it’s algae, it blooms, grows and sticks to the sides and bottom of the pool. You won’t die from swimming in the algae or copper-laden water. But, chances are, when you come out, your skin will itch as if you had rolled in fiberglass. Do yourself a favor and get the water tested; treat it and then enjoy a nice dunk! Also, if the pool water has turned green because of copper, you will notice your fingernails, bathing suits and hair will be tinged green. A good soapy shower will remove the green tint.

Not taking into consideration any of the possible health risks, if the pool water is not clear and you got into trouble, you may not be visible to anyone that may be able to rescue you.
